intro: Mulgedium ponticum, commonly known as the Pontic mulgedium, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine. Mulgedium ponticum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
